TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the police authorities impounded the applicant 's vehicle suspecting that it had been stolen .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Osijek Municipal State Attorney 's ORG gave a decision by which it refused to institute criminal proceedings against a certain DATE a person from whom in DATE the applicant had bought the car DATE and dismissed the criminal complaint relating thereto . It however failed to decide on returning the vehicle to the applicant .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE the applicant brought a civil action against the ORG in ORG ( PERSON ) seeking recovery of the impounded vehicle or , alternatively , pecuniary damages . Subsequently , on DATE , the applicant withdrew the first claim maintaining the one for damages .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave judgment dismissing the applicant 's claim . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG ( Županijski sud u GPE ) quashed the first - instance judgment for misapplication of substantive law and remitted the case .

CARDINAL . In the resumed proceedings , ORG held hearings on DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE . The hearings scheduled for DATE and DATE were adjourned owing to the illness of the judge assigned to hear the case , and to the applicant 's absence , respectively .

CARDINAL . On DATE the parties reached an in - court settlement ( sudska nagodba ) whereby the ORG was to return the vehicle to the applicant , pay her CARDINAL NORP kunas ( HRK ) in respect of pecuniary damages , cover the costs of the proceedings in the amount of HRK CARDINAL,CARDINAL and pay the statutory default interest on these amounts accruable from the date of settlement , all within DATE . Under NORP law an in - court settlement is equal , in terms of its effects , to a res judicata judgment and constitutes an enforcement title .

CARDINAL . NORP Since the ORG failed to perform the assumed obligations , on DATE the applicant applied to ORG for enforcement of the part of the above settlement concerning payment of damages and costs of proceedings . The case was later on transferred to ORG ( PERSON ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a writ of execution ( rješenje o ovrsi ) , which was carried out on DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant 's vehicle has not been returned to her . The Government submitted that she had never attempted to enforce that part of the in - court settlement . The applicant , however , submitted that , relying on the settlement , she had attempted to retrieve her vehicle from the police authorities but had been sent from CARDINAL location to another , at none of which her car could be found .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint under LAW of LAW complaining about the length of the above proceedings . On DATE ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) dismissed her complaint finding that the delay was attributable to the complexity of the case and the applicant 's conduct . In particular , it found that the applicant had contributed to the length of the proceedings in that she had failed to attend the hearing of DATE . As to the conduct of ORG , ORG observed that there had existed CARDINAL substantial periods during which no hearings had been held . However , even though they altogether amounted to DATE , they had been justified because in that period ORG had been taking evidence by corresponding with the competent administrative authorities .
CARDINAL . The relevant part of LAW on LAW ( Ustavni zakon o PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE – “ LAW ” ) reads as follows :
Section CARDINAL

“ ( CARDINAL ) The Constitutional Court shall examine a constitutional complaint whether or not all legal remedies have been exhausted if the competent court fails to decide a claim concerning the applicant 's rights and obligations or a criminal charge against him or her within a reasonable time ...

( CARDINAL ) If a constitutional complaint ... under paragraph CARDINAL of this section is upheld , the Constitutional Court shall set a time - limit within which the competent court must decide the case on the merits ...

( CARDINAL ) In a decision issued under paragraph CARDINAL of this section , the Constitutional Court shall assess appropriate compensation for the applicant for the violation of his or her constitutional rights ... The compensation shall be paid out of the ORG budget within DATE from the date a request for payment is lodged . ”

CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW ( Zakon o krivičnom postupku , ORG nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL ( consolidated text ) , CARDINAL ( errata ) and CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , as in force at the material time , provided as follows :

Objects of evidentiary value shall be impounded temporarily and returned to the owner after the conclusion of the proceedings . If such an object is indispensable to the owner , it may be returned to him or her even before the conclusion of the proceedings but he or she shall be obliged to bring it upon request .
If there is a risk of delay , the police authorities may even before the commencement of the investigation temporarily impound objects pursuant to the provision of section CARDINAL of this Act ...

( CARDINAL ) Objects which have to be seized pursuant to LAW , or which may be used as evidence in criminal proceedings , shall be temporarily impounded and deposited with a court , or their safe - keeping shall be secured in another way .

( CARDINAL ) The police authorities may impound the objects referred to in paragraph ( CARDINAL ) when acting under the provisions of [ inter alia , section ] ... CARDINAL of this LAW , or when executing a court order .

The objects which were temporarily impounded in the course of the criminal proceedings shall be returned to their owner or holder upon the termination of the proceedings if their seizure is not required ( section CARDINAL ) .

( CARDINAL ) Objects that must be seized according to LAW shall also be seized when criminal proceedings do not end with a judgment convicting the accused , provided that this is required by considerations of public safety or the protection of morals .
( CARDINAL ) The authority before which the proceedings were pending at the time they ended or were discontinued shall render a separate decision thereon .

( CARDINAL ) The decision on the seizure of objects referred to in paragraph ( CARDINAL ) of this section shall also be given by a court when it has failed to give such a decision in a judgment convicting the accused .
( CARDINAL ) A certified written copy of the decision on the seizure of objects shall be served on the owner of the object , if he is known .

( CARDINAL ) The owner of the object is entitled to appeal against the decision referred to in paragraphs ( CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) of this section if he or she considers that no legal ground for the seizure of the object existed . If the decision referred to in paragraph ( CARDINAL ) of this section was not given by a court , the panel of the competent first - instance court shall decide on the appeal .
